messages.title: 3 positive reasons to vote for George Lee
messages.content: 1. Unlike Frank Dobson George is not a career politician. He has the skills and experience to do the job and will be a hardworking, honest public servant with integrity and fairness at core values. 2. Real-world experience vs. a shiny faced 20-something university student or a beer-gargling, working in a factory town MP! Metropolitan police officer (working in Vice, Drugs, Murder, Riot and Organised Crime Squads) and a successful private sector career. 3. George understands the constituency. He walks the beat in Holborn & Kings Cross (dealing with the homeless or in Lincoln’s Inn fields) and helping casualties at the Kings Cross fire, He understands what that makes this area special.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Save the Whittington Hospital A&E Department
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposed to the closure of the A&E Department and has received assurance from the Shadow Health Secretary, Andrew Lansley, that a future Conservative Government would stop the review of clinical services at the Whittington.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: High speed rail tunnel under our homes - George Lee says No!
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes Labour's plan for a new High Speed 2 rail line from London to Birmingham. Supports local Conservatives in standing up to the proposed threat.
Supports leaseholders across Camden who are unhappy at the amount they have been asked to pay by the Lib Dem Housing Department for repair work done to their properties.
Opposed the building of a drug treatment centre and needle exchange in Holborn. Joined local residents in fighting the proposal, and the idea was dropped.
Against the selling off of more than 1,300 properties on the Crown Estate in Cumberland Market and has lobbied to stop this from happening.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Voters here will decide who runs this country after the next election - Gordon Brown or David Cameron. This is a key seat which the Conservatives need to win to form a Government. Your local vote directly decides the outcome. A vote for any party but the Conservatives risks leaving Gordon Brown in Downing Street or a hung Parliament - both are disastrous for the country.

issues.health: Opposed to the closure of the A&E Department at the Whittington Hospital.

housing.content: Supports leaseholders against charges by the Lib Dem Housing Department and opposes the sell-off of properties on the Crown Estate.

images.caption: George Lee with supporters campaigning on various local issues.
